quest.name: It's Probably Pirates
journal: Baderon, the proprietor of the Drowning Wench, has need of a capable adventurer.

Baderon and Commodore Reyner have requested your assistance with an investigation. A strange ship has been sighted off the coast of Aleport, and the subsequent appearance of a dangerous-looking group of men at the Sastasha Seagrot has the Yellowjackets greatly concerned. Speak with V'mellpa at the ferry docks on the lower decks, and receive directions to the location of the caves.

V'mellpa has suggested that you pay a visit to the Hall of the Novice before continuing your journey to Sastasha. Make your way to the Adventurers' Guild building located north of Aleport, and speak with the seasoned adventurer.
You have concluded your educational visit to the Hall of the Novice. Continue on to the north, and speak with the Yellowjacket stationed outside the entrance to Sastasha.

The Yellowjackets are concerned that the unsavory-looking men seen entering Sastasha may belong to the Serpent Reavers, the pirate allies of the Sahagin. Search the caves and ascertain whether or not such suspicions are well founded.

※Challenge Sastasha with other players via the Duty Finder, or with a party of NPCs via Duty Support. Both systems are accessible from the main menu as well as the dungeon's entrance point.

You have discovered a pirate den in the depths of Sastasha. Just as the Yellowjackets feared, it would appear the Serpent Reavers and their Sahagin masters are using the caves as a base for their nefarious operations. Return to Limsa Lominsa without delay, and report your findings to Baderon at the Drowning Wench.

Having listened to your findings, Baderon expresses his satisfaction with your work, and mentions another task which might be of interest to you. It seems the Adventurers' Guild in Gridania wishes to employ the services of a seasoned adventurer. Prepare your gear, then speak with Baderon when you are ready to embark on the next stage of your journey.
objectives: Speak with the seasoned adventurer at the Hall of the Novice.
Speak with the Yellowjacket at the entrance to Sastasha.
Speak with Baderon at the Drowning Wench.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To accept this quest, you must abandon the current main scenario quest. Open the corresponding entry in the journal or duty list and select “Abandon.”

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: I thank ye fer takin' the time to 'elp me out. Now, I'm sure yer busy, so I'll come straight to the point.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Word 'as it some suspicious-lookin' buggers 'ave been sneakin' in an' out o' the Sastasha Seagrot, an' I need a trustworthy sort to 'ead up north of Aleport an' find out who they are an' what they're up to.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Don't sound like much, I know...

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: But since that nasty business over in Swiftperch, folk've been a bit uneasy. Well, I say “a bit”... 'Tis all they can do not to soil 'emselves every time the bloody floorboards creak.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: But it weren't so long ago as the fishbacks' pet pirates paid us an unwelcome visit, an' folk are feelin' a bit nervous.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: If you would permit me, Master Baderon, I should be happy to elaborate.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Well, well, if it ain't the chief Yellowjacket 'imself. To what do I owe this rare honor, Commodore Reyner? Come to make sure me patrons are behavin'─or just thirsty?

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Neither, in fact. I came to welcome Forename back to Limsa Lominsa. It is well you have returned.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Neither, in fact. I was informed that you had requested an adventurer to assist in my investigation, and I came to offer what information I could sift from recent reports.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Over the course of the past moon, there have been several sightings of an unfamiliar vessel off the coast of Aleport, in the vicinity of the Isles of Umbra.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: This information came to my attention no more than a few weeks after a squad of my own soldiers had completed a routine patrol of the region, the Sastasha Seagrot included.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Their search revealed little, save that a family of coeurls had taken up residence in the caves. Nothing to concern us, in short.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: In light of recent developments, however, it would seem wise to search Sastasha again.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: But with the Sahagin testing our defenses daily, I am loath to assign the task to the limited forces at my disposal. Our line is stretched as it is.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Thus I sought the services of a competent adventurer to conduct an investigation in our stead. Any aid you can offer in this matter would be greatly appreciated.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Then it is settled.

dialogue.name: REYNER
dialogue.text: Sastasha is located in western La Noscea. For more detailed instructions on how to reach the place, I suggest you consult V'mellpa. She can be found at the ferry docks on the lower decks.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: You 'eard the man! Good luck to ye, lasslad!

dialogue.name: VMELLPA
dialogue.text: You're here about Commodore Reyner's investigation? Then you'll want to board a ferry bound for Aleport.

dialogue.name: VMELLPA
dialogue.text: Once you arrive in western La Noscea, though, you'd best pay a visit to the Hall of the Novice before you blunder into Sastasha.

dialogue.name: VMELLPA
dialogue.text: The Adventurers' Guild runs the Hall, and the folk there will prepare you─train you with the skills you'll need to face the dangers undoubtedly waiting for you in the Seagrot.

dialogue.name: VMELLPA
dialogue.text: The Hall is on the way to Sastasha, just north of Aleport. Head inside and one of their seasoned adventurers will take you in hand. Best of luck to you, friend!

dialogue.name: VMELLPA
dialogue.text: No matter what they've told you, be ready for pirates. There's never any shortage of the bastards. This is Limsa Lominsa we're talking about...

dialogue.name: AIDE00675
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be the adventurer of whom the Yellowjackets sent word. I hear you are to brave the depths of the Sastasha Seagrot.

dialogue.name: AIDE00675
dialogue.text: The occupants of those caves are rumored to be as numerous as they are bloodthirsty. No matter what the epic tales would have you believe, strolling into such a den of savagery alone would be the height of foolishness. No, you shall need companions.

dialogue.name: AIDE00675
dialogue.text: And you shall need the training we here at the Hall of the Novice can provide! I strongly suggest that you study the fundamentals of group combat before continuing on your mission.

dialogue.name: AIDE00675
dialogue.text: The Smith here oversees the training schedules. Speak with him, and you can register for exercises tailored to your particular field of expertise.

dialogue.name: AIDE00675
dialogue.text: When you have mastered all that our masters have to teach, then it will be time to head north once more. Report to the Yellowjacket scout at the mouth of the Sastasha Seagrot, and he will furnish you with the details of your duty.

dialogue.name: AIDE00675
dialogue.text: When your skills have been honed and your mind sharpened, continue onwards to the north. The Yellowjacket scout stationed before the Sastasha Seagrot will have the details of your mission.

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: Please tell me you're here on Yellowjacket duty, and not some daft sod out for a stroll. I can't take any more of this blasted waiting. You are? Thank the gods.

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: I assume you already know about the ship seen slipping around the Isles of Umbra?

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: We've been on the lookout for pirate activity ever since that vessel was sighted, thinking a crew of cutthroats might have a den nearby.

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: So when we received word that men of questionable quality had been seen passing in and out of Sastasha here, we weren't entirely surprised.

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: I've yet to see them for myself, but if this lot belongs to those fishback-fancying Serpent Reavers...

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: Well, you can imagine the panic it'll cause. The kidnappings are still fresh in people's minds.

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: Anyway, your task is to poke around in the caves, and find out exactly who we're dealing with. While you do that, I'll be keeping watch out here...praying you don't spot any blue face tattoos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Enter Sastasha.

dialogue.name: AVERE
dialogue.text: What took ye so bloody long, Edda? If me purse was too light, ye might've considered usin' some of yer own bleedin' coin to get us what we need!

dialogue.name: AVERE
dialogue.text: Ye've only ever been as useful as the contents o' yer pockets─the gods know ye can barely 'eal a scratch!

dialogue.name: AVERE
dialogue.text: We took up the 'venturin' life to take on the big jobs an' claim the big rewards. How're we meant to do that if ye can't even get our supplies in order?

dialogue.name: AVERE
dialogue.text: Hm? It's 'er'im─the one Baderon was talkin' to!

dialogue.name: AVERE
dialogue.text: Well, we'll see who gets the glory! This job should've been ours in the first place!

dialogue.name: LIAVINNE
dialogue.text: Bwahahaha! Edda, you're so slow, you'd lose a footrace to a tree slug.

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: This is perfect for our inaugural outing as a party─wandering around in the caves, turning over a few rocks... How difficult could it possibly be?

dialogue.name: PAIYOREIYO
dialogue.text: I never expected our first visit to the Adventurers' Guild would yield such a straightforward way to win fame and fortune.

dialogue.name: EDDA
dialogue.text: <gasp> I-I'm sorry, Avere! I came as fast as I could!

dialogue.name: EDDA
dialogue.text: I tried haggling with the merchant, but two potions was the best I could get with the money you gave me. I had no idea how expensive they were!

dialogue.name: ISILDAURE
dialogue.text: Ah, a fellow adventurer. You, too, are here to unravel the mysteries of Sastasha?

dialogue.name: ISILDAURE
dialogue.text: I have adventured across this wide realm for more seasons than I dare to count, yet still Eorzea manages to surprise me with her beauty and splendor.

dialogue.name: ISILDAURE
dialogue.text: Our journeys are not ended by the attainment of riches or fame. It is an unquenchable thirst for the unknown that drives us into the wilds time and again.

dialogue.name: ISILDAURE
dialogue.text: Even if I explored the world for a thousand years, I would never grow weary of this life.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: Grandfather and I are companions on the road.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: We travel where the wind takes us, and drink in all the wonders this world has to offer.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: Only an adventurer can understand the joy of such freedom─of discovering hidden places and experiencing sights and sounds that few may ever know.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: The passing years have begun to take their toll on the old man, but no force save death itself will sate his appetite for adventure!

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: The fishbacks and their Serpent Reaver lackeys cannot be allowed to establish a permanent base in these lands.

dialogue.name: YELLOWJACKET
dialogue.text: You must uncover the truth behind who or what is lurking in these caves, adventurer. The peace of western La Noscea may depend on it!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Aye, such a task was on the books. “Was,” mind. I'm afraid that ship 'as already sailed, friend.

dialogue.name: DOLOROUSBEAR
dialogue.text: Ah. Might you be the adventurer who accepted the job of investigating Sastasha?

dialogue.name: DOLOROUSBEAR
dialogue.text: Hmph. It would seem that ship has not only sailed, but now returns to harbor, none the worse for its voyage. A pity. We dragged our boots too long on this one.

dialogue.name: EMANAFA
dialogue.text: No matter. The wheel will turn and our chance will come.

dialogue.name: DOLOROUSBEAR
dialogue.text: You are right, of course. But there shall be no rest till we have attained our goal, lofty though it may be!

dialogue.name: KIKINA
dialogue.text: Not a wink of sleep, great leader!

dialogue.name: DOLOROUSBEAR
dialogue.text: Our aim, lest you wonder, is to perform such feats of heroism as will earn us a place in the songs of every alehouse in Eorzea. We mean to write a legend which will inspire adventurers as yet unborn to follow our shining example.

dialogue.name: DOLOROUSBEAR
dialogue.text: Do you have such a goal? Large or small, it matters not. Only have a star to reach for and you will reach higher.

dialogue.name: DOLOROUSBEAR
dialogue.text: Purpose can sustain you through times of hardship. Keep your eye on the prize, and all obstacles will be overcome in time.

dialogue.name: DOLOROUSBEAR
dialogue.text: You would not think to stride into battle unclad, would you? Well, goals are as arms and armor for the spirit! I wish you fortune in your endeavors, miladysir!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Back then, are ye? With all yer limbs, an' a tale to tell, I'll wager.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Fishbacks? An' there I was thinkin' ye'd only 'ave to crack a pirate skull or three. Seven hells... Ye turn yer back fer five bloody minutes, an' the scaly bastards've set up shop on yer bleedin' doorstep...

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Still, sounds like ye left 'em in pieces, so I don't s'pose they'll be carryin' out whatever mischief they was plannin'─unless they was plannin' on feedin' 'emselves to the fauna o' Sastasha, o' course. Anyroad, all's well that ends well!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Thanks fer sheddin' some light on this mystery. I knew ye'd get the job done, lasslad─ye always do!

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: On behalf o' Limsa, I thank ye fer sheddin' some light on this mystery. Ye've lived up to yer reputation, an' I couldn't ask fer no more'n that.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Now, I'll bet yer dyin' fer a rest, but just in case yer not, I was wonderin' if ye might be interested in takin' on another job? It just so 'appens that I've 'ad a request from our sister guild in Gridania, see.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Seems the forest folk're in need of a 'venturer what can get things done.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Fer them to ask fer 'elp like this, ye can bet the task won't be no skip through a sunny glade. But after the way ye dealt with our fishback infestation, I doubt it's anythin' ye can't 'andle.

dialogue.name: BADERON
dialogue.text: Give us a shout when yer ready, an' I'll lay it out fer ye.
